On the western flank of Pokrovsk, Russian forces resumed their assault operations along the Donetsk - Dnipropetrovsk Regional Border in Molodetske, and have secured important positions south of the railway line.
After accumulating infantry, Russian forces advanced from their foothold in the southern houses of Molodetske, moving north to the railway tracks. They established full control over the village and the parallel treeline to the west and were able to secure positions in the southern railway windbreak. Other forces attacked north up a treeline towards the eastern outskirts of Molodetske, where they too reached the railway line, capturing its southern windbreak. This linked them up with formations west of Udachne, forming a unified front against the western flank of the Pokrovsk Coal Mine on the highest point of the tactical heights. 
+ ~1.15 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continued their offensive in Pokrovsk and have made additional progress south of the railway line.
After securing positions in the Hospital District and the southern part of the Prospecta District, Russian forces began pushing further north. They were able to consolidate in at least 5 more blocks of the Prospecta District and continued to advance north and northwest through the Sobachivka District. 
Meanwhile, infiltrations continue towards the railway line. Russian soldiers and DRGs are operating in all parts of the city south of the tracks, including at the railway station in the city centre, and the highway overpass in the east suburbs. They are also infiltrating deeper into the northwestern industrial zone, where the grey zone now extends beyond the city limits in the direction of Hryshyne. No consolidation has occurred north of the railway line yet.
+ ~0.61 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

 ‚Äî Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu:
In response to the ceasefire violation, we attacked Hamas yesterday with 153 tons of bombs. We also hit senior commanders. 
A ceasefire is not a license to harm us. 
At the end of the process, Hamas will be eliminated politically and militarily.
@TabZLIVE

üáÆüá±

üáµüá∏
 ‚Äî Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu:
The government under my leadership did not accept any of Hamas's demands.
@TabZLIVE
Permanent ceasefire, am I right?

All those naive people when the war and genocide starts again will be so confused why the "peace president" couldn't stop it. 
It's almost as if Trump's plan was terribly laid out and had very few guarantees for Hamas (let alone the other Palestinian factions and movements in Gaza).
I honestly think the goal was to make a peace plan that was borderline acceptable for Hamas, but just slightly too far outside of what they could feasibly agree too, in order to portray them as unwilling to end the war and rebuild some justification for the IDF to continue their operations. 
Hamas actually accepting the deal surprised the US and Israel, so now they are relying on ceasefire violations to slowly swing back to a fighting stance.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continued to advance towards Myrnohrad from the east and have made further progress inside the city limits. 
In the north, after establishing control over the Kapitalna Mine, Russian forces advanced down the highway to the industrial zone on the outskirts of Myrnohrad, establishing control over it. Using this to accumulate additional infantry, Russian forces broke into the northeastern suburbs of Myrnohrad, establishing control over Travnya 1 Street. Ukrainian forces withdrew from the area and are now repeating their strategy employed with the other Russian breach into the city, with striking every occupied house in an attempt to prevent consolidation and further accumulation of soldiers. In addition to this advance, the Russians were able to establish full control over the wastewater treatment plant and the surrounding areas.
To the south, after entering southeastern Myrnohrad and widening the breach in Ukrainian defences, Russian forces began attacking north into the village of Balahan. They entered the southern dachas, and pushed up into the main residential area, linking up with their formations in the forests to the east.
To the southwest, despite extensive Ukrainian FPV drone strikes, the Russians were able to consolidate further in the first houses of Myrnohrad, accumulating additional infantry for further attacks. They pushed further west down Stritenska and Syerova Streets and entered the eastern houses of Razina Street. As a result of these attacks, Russia has now secured a 1.3 km-long residential stretch of Myrnohrad, and is within 500 metres of the first high-rise residential buildings. 
+ ~2.86 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Zoomed-in maps showing the Russian breaches into northeastern and southeastern Myrnohrad.
As Ukrainian supply into the Pokrovsk salient gets worse and worse, the deepest sections of the salient will begin to collapse.

Zoomed-in maps showing the Russian breaches into northeastern and southeastern Myrnohrad.
As Ukrainian supply into the Pokrovsk salient gets worse and worse, the deepest sections of the salient will begin to collapse.
In Lviv, TCC mobilisation officers pulled a man out of an ambulance to be arrested and likely sent to the frontline.
In Lviv, TCC mobilisation officers pulled a man out of an ambulance to be arrested and likely sent to the frontline.

In the Dobropillya direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces are advancing, each taking various positions amid intensified fighting.
On the western part of the Kucheriv Yar salient, Russian forces continued stabilisation measures following the Ukrainian counterattacks last month. They were able to once again regain the initiative in the Nove Shakhove area, entering the village from the east and establishing control over most of it. Fighting is ongoing for its western houses which are currently in the grey zone. 
Russian forces have also begun attacks on Vilne from the northeast with its newly accumulated infantry. Fighting is ongoing for the forested areas just outside the village. The Russians are also carrying out attacks on Ivanivka from the southeast in an attempt to bring the village back under their control and level the front southwest of Nove Skakhove. 
Additional attacks are being carried out northwest of Zatyshok, where Russia is trying to consolidate in the forest plantations in the direction of the railway line in order to solidify their presence on the Zatyshok - Sukhetske line. Ukrainian forces resumed their assault operations towards the treelines south of Nykanorivka, attacking from their positions east of the railway line.
In the eastern part of the Kucheriv Yar salient, fierce fighting is ongoing for the Volodymyrivka - Shakhove area. After repelling Russian assaults on northern Volodymyrivka, and inflicting heavy casualties on the initial force dropped off by the earlier mechanised assault, Ukrainian forces began attacking south from the northern street with their newly accumulated infantry, and captured new residential areas in the northern part of the village. Other forces began attacking southeast, establishing control over part of the agricultural complex and advancing down the treeline south of the Novyy Reservoir. 
At the same time, additional Russian reinforcements were brought into southern Volodymyrivka, which are now trying to counterattack in the centre of the village.  Russian forces are also trying to consolidate in the forest plantations north of Novyy Reservoir again, while the Ukrainians attack through the forest plantations on the southeastern approaches to Shakhove.
+ ~2.57 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
+ ~0.55 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.

On the northeastern flank of Pokrovsk, as Russian forces penetrate deep into Pokrovsk City, a new series of attacks on Rodynske has begun.
After their initial failed attempts at taking the city, Russia regrouped and refocused their efforts on other areas. Since stabilising the situation in the Kucheriv Yar salient and beginning attacks into Pokrovsk, Russian forces have managed to break into Rodynske and begin fighting for large parts of the city.
They advanced west from positions in the area of the mine and terykon, and broke into the high-rise microdistrict in western Rodynske, establishing control over most of it. Other forces expanded their foothold in the city to the low-rise residential areas to the north, where they are now trying to storm the Ukrainian defences in the four-story buildings further west. 
Meanwhile, the Russians were able to break into the northern part of the city - which had a smaller Ukrainian presence - and establish control over large parts of it. Assault operations are now underway towards the city centre from the east, northeast, and north, while intense FAB and artillery bombardment of Ukrainian positions there and in the western suburbs is ongoing.
+ ~3.94 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations towards the rear of the Kleban-Bykske Reservoir and have managed to secure important positions here.
Despite previous failed attacks here, Russian forces were able to advance out of Yablunivka to the east and enter the forests north of Oleksandro-Kalynove. With this southern sector secured, other soldiers advanced up the highway, establishing control over several strongpoints and approaching the rear of the reservoir. Attacks were also carried out on the first forests situated behind the reservoir, but they were repelled, mostly by Ukrainian FPV drones (which have been doing most of the work in this sector for some time). 
+ ~1.20 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

It was deleted shortly afterwards lol.

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Russian forces continued to advance towards Kostyantynivka, and have captured positions in three different areas.
In the east, Russian forces secured the treelines and forest plantations north of Bila Hora which were previously in the grey zone, levelling the frontline south of the fortified forests. Additional attacks are being carried out on the main forest, as well as on the central part of Predtechyne.
To the west, Russian forces advanced back into the Yahidka Dachas southeast of Kostyantynivka, consolidating in the eastern half of them. Russian soldiers are infiltrating further, reaching the Kostyantynivka city limits, as well as the areas behind Predtechyne. 
In the south, after weeks of assault operations, Russian forces were finally able to consolidate in the southern part of Pleshchiivka, and began attacks to the northwest where they are attempting to entrench in the denser residential areas. 
+ ~4.93 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Lyman direction, Russian forces continued their offensive towards Lyman from the east and have made progress in two different areas.
In the north, Russian forces were able to eliminate the Ukrainian pocket in and around Myrne after an attack from the north and from the east over the Yampolivka Dam. Additional positions were captured to the south, thereby securing the route north of Zarichne to be used for future offensive actions. 
In the south, Russian forces continued attacks through the Yampil forest. They advanced for at least 1 km to the west (north of the railway line), while DRGs began infiltrating even deeper towards the southeastern outskirts of Lyman itself. Additionally, as a result of the advances being made in the forests to the south and north, the Russians closed the salient southwest of Zarichne, establishing control over 6 treelines and the northern part of the Yampil Forest. 
+ ~19.56 in favour of Russia.

On the northwestern flank of Lyman, Russian forces intensified their assault operations, making significant advances over the past few days. 
Russian forces continued to advance in southern Novoselivka, reaching the rear of the village. This, plus renewed Russian attacks towards the centre of the village from the north forced the remaining Ukrainian formations to withdraw west. 
Other forces to the northwest were able to consolidate in the large forests after previous attacks and began expanding further west. They were also able to enter these same forests from southwestern Novoselivka and capture positions there, forcing the Ukrainians to withdraw further back from areas directly west of Novoselivka to the eastern approaches to Yarova. 
Additionally, Russian forces managed to break through Ukrainian positions south of Novoselivka, where they advanced southwest through the forests and infiltrated the southeastern houses of Yarova. Fighting is now ongoing here, but it means that one of two remaining roads to Drobysheve (which was also previously used to supply Lyman) has been cut.
Meanwhile in the east, Russian forces continued to slowly advance in Drobysheve. After capturing the agricultural buildings on the northeastern outskirts of the town, they entered the residential areas to the south. The main assault groups continued to push towards the town centre and have established control over positions on Pushkina Street.
+ ~8.44 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Kupyansk direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations on the Ukrainian bridgehead on the eastern bank of the Oskil River and have made new progress towards Pishchane.
Following the recapture of previously lost positions west of Stepova Novosilka, Russian forces have continued to advance west, building on their momentum. They advanced along the railway line for more than 2.9 km, seizing numerous trenches and dugouts along the way. Once they reached the eastern outskirts of Pishchane, the Russian began entering the village, capturing trenches and houses there. 
So far, they are only confirmed to be in control of the easternmost edge of the village, while the rest is in the grey zone, but they have attempted to consolidate in the northeastern streets. Meanwhile, additional attacks were carried out to the north, where Russian forces captured new treeline positions in the low-lying ground. 
+ ~3.57 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Lebanese Court Orders Release Of Gaddafi Son Who Was Abducted From Syria
A judge in Lebanon has ordered the release of Hannibal Gaddafi, the youngest son of the late Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi, on a bail of $11 million and a travel ban.
Hannibal has been held for nearly a decade in pre-trial detention in a case related to the kidnapping and disappearance of revered Lebanese Shia leader Musa al-Sadr in Libya. The bail ruling was made by Judge Zaher Hamadeh, the judicial investigator in the case of al-Sadr‚Äôs disappearance, Lebanon‚Äôs official National News Agency reported on October 17.
Al-Sadr is the founder of the Amal Movement, which is now an ally of Hezbollah. He went missing along with an aide and a journalist in 1978 when they went to meet with then-Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi.

Russian Army Is About To Trap Kiev Forces In Liman
On October 20, the Russian military advanced closer to the city of Krasny Liman in the Donetsk direction, threatening to trap Kiev forces behind the Siverskyi Donets River.
To the north of Krasny Liman, the Yug [South] Group of Forces broke through Ukrainian defenses north and west of Novoselivka, reaching the Yarova which was located right along the Siverskyi Donets. Kiev forces are almost besieged in the center and eastern parts of Novoselivka, and Russian troops are reportedly entering Yarova.
The capture of Yarova, which may be a few days away, could mark the start of the collapse of Ukrainian defenses along the river, all the way down to south of Krasny Liman, where the Yug Group of Force has also made gains.
üëâ

Russian Troops Advance In Pokrovsk And Along Yanchur Line 
On October 20, the Russian military advanced in several areas from the city of Pokrovsk in the Donetsk direction to the line along the Yanchur River in the Dnepropetrovsk direction.
To the east of Pokrovsk, the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces began storming the southern part of Myrnohrad from nearby Balahan, which was captured very recently. It‚Äôs worth noting that Russian troops are already attempting to advance in the eastern part of the large settlement, although Ukrainian troops are still showing resistance there.
The Tsentr Group of Forces made additional gains in Pokrovsk itself, capturing the railway station building in the heart of the city.

Israel‚Äôs Secretive Surveillance Jet Spotted Over Syria On Possible Mission Against Iran 
One of Israel‚Äôs secretive Gulfstream G550-based high-altitude surveillance aircraft was spotted flying over southern Syria on October 20, marking the first such sighting since the war with Iran in June.
A video showing the aircraft over al-Suwayda was shared by a local news blog, with activists from the governorate reporting that the aircraft was escorted by fighter jets.
The Israeli Air Force (IAF) operates two special mission versions of the G550, both were locally developed by Israel Aerospace Industries and ELTA Systems.

U.S. Envoy Warns Israel Could Resume War On Lebanon As Strikes Hit Hezbollah Heartland 
United States special envoy for Syria Tom Barrack warned on October 20 that Israel could resume war on Lebanon if the country fails to disarm Hezbollah, all while another wave of strikes hit the heartland of the group in the south of the country.
Barrack made the warning in a lengthy opinion piece on the prospect of peace in the Middle East that he published on his X account.
‚ÄúShould Beirut continue to hesitate, Israel may act unilaterally ‚Äì and the consequences would be grave,‚Äù cautioned Barrack.
‚ÄúIf Beirut fails to act, Hizballah‚Äôs military arm will inevitably face major confrontation with Israel at a moment of Israel‚Äôs strength and Iran backed Hizballah‚Äôs weakest point,‚Äù wrote Barrack, who is also the U.S. envoy to Turkey.
